page.title: 17Brixton Building Site
page.content: A building firm called J.Edgar & Son is building 9 detached four-bedroomed houses on a site by the Lodge. First of all they dig foundation pits and line them with concrete. Then they build a double wall of concrete blocks. There is a gap in between called the cavity to allow air to circulate and keep damp out. Then they put in wooden floors, windows, doors etc. They put wooden roof trusses up and cover them with tiles. Then they put in all the wiring, plumbing and plaster the walls inside to a smooth finish ready for painting. The outside walls are finished with Arcalite (shiny stone chippings) or left as red brick. There are 4 managers, 1 plumber, 1 electrician, 2 labourers, 1 plasterer and 4 bricklayers working there. It takes 3 to 5 months to build a house. They cost Â£85000 to Â£120000.
